bio.1: I’m Dania Alnahdi, a student from Bahrain pursuing a BS in Computer Science and Design in Boston, MA. I’m interested in web and software development, inclusive and human-centered technology, and interactive (and pretty) user interfaces.
bio.2: Thanks to my coursework at Northeastern University, industry experience at Asics Digital and MFS, and the numerious internet rabbit holes I tumble into, I’m always exploring new skills from both the development and design worlds.
bio.3: When I’m not behind my computer, you’ll likely find me advocating for causes I’m passionate about, discovering plant-based food joints, or searching for a cat to pet.

project1.name: Personal Website
project1.description: This very website! My goal was to create a responsive website from scratch using modern JavaScript tooling. I also added my own illustrations for a more personalized feel.

project2.name: Build for Black Lives
project2.description: An online platform that connects Black businesses and organizations to developers and creatives offering pro bono services. I had the pleasure of kickstarting and collaborating on this initiative as an organizer for HackBeanpot!

project3.name: Eco Eateries
project3.description: This winning hackathon project is a goal-tracker for restaurants to adopt sustainable business practices. As the only frontend developer on the team, I was in charge of building the user interface, which included an interactive Kanban board.

project4.name: Saltwater Classroom
project4.description: An educational mobile app for kids to learn about ocean conservation, created for nonprofit Saltwater Classroom. I collaborated on designing and building the frontend as a part of Scout, Northeastern University's student-led design studio.

project5.name: reCursor
project5.description: This hackathon project is a fun Google Chrome extension that changes your browser’s cursor to an icon from any category you pick. Made it to top 10 projects!

project6.name: Space Explorer
project6.description: My first venture into creative coding: a light-hearted space adventure game inspired by 8-bit arcade games. I had a lot of fun setting up the scoreboard functionality, and also with designing the tiny spaceships!

contact.heading: Say hi!
